sentences.english: Smoke curls slowly from the chimney.
Only the residual sounds of the bell remain.
sentences.chinese: 只留下鸽铃那袅袅的余音。

sentences.english: Long-stemmed models ankled though the lobby.
sentences.chinese: 身材修长的模特儿袅袅婷婷地走过大厅。

sentences.english: Smoke from the camp-fires spiraled up into a clear sky.
sentences.chinese: 营火冒出的烟袅袅升上明净的天空。

sentences.english: I saw a curl of smoke rising from his cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 我看见一缕烟从他的香烟上袅袅升起。

sentences.english: Within a minute, a cloud of tiny droplets forms in the goldfish bowl.
sentences.chinese: 不到一分钟，鱼缸形的容器内就飘出袅袅烟气。

sentences.english: A thin wisp of smoke straggled up through the trees.
sentences.chinese: 一缕轻烟在林间袅袅升起。

sentences.english: As we know, autumn in south has endless poetry.
sentences.chinese: 阡陌相交，炊烟袅袅，江南的秋有写不尽的诗情。

sentences.english: A thin curl of smoke arose lazily from the cabin .
sentences.chinese: 一缕轻烟从小屋上袅袅升起。

sentences.english: A column of smoke winding into the sky.
The aromatic smoke of cooking fires floated lazily aloft.
sentences.chinese: 炊烟带着诱人的香味袅袅上升，随风飘荡。

sentences.english: Long-stemmed models ankled through the lobby.
sentences.chinese: 身材修长的模特袅袅婷婷地从厅中走过。

sentences.english: The village, the curl of smoke is rising.
sentences.chinese: 村里，袅袅的炊烟已然升起。

sentences.english: By day thin plumes of smoke hung against the sky like ragged grey ribbons.
sentences.chinese: 白天，袅袅青烟如破烂的灰丝带高悬空中。

definition: to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
variant of 飄渺|飘渺[piao1 miao3]
